title: Ishan out, Sanju in: India spinner announces playing XI vs USA in T20 World Cup
description: Despite a stellar T20I series, Ishan Kishan was surprisingly omitted from Yuzvendra Chahal's preferred XI for India's T20 World Cup opener. Chahal opted for the struggling Sanju Samson to open alongside Abhishek Sharma, a decision that raises eyebrows given Kishan's dominant recent form.

description: What the thread is really selling is not a claim about 1999. It is a mood about now. A belief that the powerful do unspeakable things behind closed doors, and that anyone who shows us the door gets removed from the building.

description: Rohit Sharma, honored with the Padma Shri, expressed deep gratitude for the prestigious civilian award, calling it a momentous occasion for his family. He reaffirmed his unwavering dedication to securing victories for India on the cricket field. This recognition celebrates his significant contributions as both a player and captain, marking a distinguished chapter in his illustrious career.

title: 'Physically handicapped': Khawaja Asif's brutal admission as Pakistan forces battle BLA
description: Pakistan's defence minister acknowledges the immense challenge of policing Balochistan's vast terrain. Security forces are battling a recent surge in militant violence.  Authorities report killing 177 insurgents in counter-terror operations.  The minister ruled out talks with groups responsible for civilian deaths.  This highlights the ongoing security crisis in the region.

title: 'Daan' at Haryana YouTuber Arun Pawar's wedding; Rs 71L cash, 21 tola gold
description: A YouTuber's wedding video showcasing substantial cash and gold gifts, termed 'daan' by the family, has ignited a fierce online debate about dowry. Critics question influencers normalizing such practices, especially given the bride's professional achievements. The controversy highlights the persistent issue of dowry, even when disguised as tradition.

description: India and the US have struck a significant trade deal, with New Delhi committing to purchase over $500 billion in American products across sectors like agriculture, defense, and petroleum. This agreement aims to lower tariffs and boost US agricultural exports to India, potentially impacting rural economies. President Trump also linked the pact to energy policy and global peace efforts.

description: Many professionals are facing tough decisions whether to return to India after spending years in the US, finding the reality of daily life less ideological and more practical than online narratives suggested. While acknowledging genuine challenges like pollution and bureaucracy, he also noted similar issues abroad and found unexpected conveniences, leading him to not regret his decision.

2 British tourists served ‘leave India’ notice over pro-Palestine stickers
description: Two British tourists were issued a 'leave India' notice by Rajasthan CID for posting stickers advocating for Palestine and opposing Israel in Pushkar. The authorities deemed the act a violation of visa regulations and local sensitivities, leading to their immediate departure mandate. All stickers have since been removed.

title: How long you will live is mainly decided by your genes: Study
description: The findings are based on an analysis of more than a century of lifespan data from large Scandinavian twin cohorts in Denmark and Sweden. Researchers studied identical and non-identical twins raised together and apart, as well as siblings of US centenarians. Most participants were born between 1870 and 1935, a period marked by high mortality from infectious diseases and accidents.

title: MP govt hospitals to get Garbh Sanskar rooms to ‘educate mind of fetus’
description: These dedicated spaces are meant to guide expectant parents through prenatal care rooted in traditional Indian practices, from positive thinking and lifestyle discipline to diet and emotional well-being. The idea: shape the mind of the unborn. CM Mohan Yadav announced the initiative Sunday in Indore, placing it under the Ayushman Bharat scheme and linking it to the Union ministry of Ayush.

title: Drake Maye’s wife Ann Michael stuns in daring Super Bowl week workout post
description: Ann Michael Maye kicked off Super Bowl 2026 week with a viral workout post as the Patriots prepare to face the Seahawks. From supporting Drake Maye at key playoff moments to launching her NBC Sports Boston show, Ann’s rise mirrors New England’s return to the sport’s biggest stage.

title: Parents to be blamed for allowing minors to drink & drive: SC
description: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said that there cannot be punishment before trial and directed release of the accused who already spent 18 months in jail. They were allegedly involved in tampering of evidence by swapping blood samples of their kids with their own. Father of the main accused, who is a minor and was allegedly driving the case, is still in jail.

title: Air India flyers land in Delhi, 40 bags left in Mumbai
description: Passengers on a Mumbai-Delhi Air India flight experienced frustration when approximately 40 checked bags failed to arrive at their destination. The airline cited unforeseen technical issues at Mumbai airport for the missing cargo. The flight, AI 2677, landed ahead of schedule, but the early arrival was overshadowed by the luggage mishap.

title: Lower than Pakistan, China: How trade deal with US gives India its edge back
description: With this deal, India bags a place among countries facing one of the lowest tariff rates from the Donald Trump administration. Incidentally, the 18% tariff rate is lower than Pakistan’s 19%, Indonesia’s 19%.

title: NHL trade buzz: Artemi Panarin rumours and Barry Trotz exit shake up deadline
description: The current NHL trade rumors center on New York Rangers player Artemi Panarin, who wants to sign a contract extension before he joins another team, which includes the Kings, Capitals, and Red Wings as potential suitors. The Nashville Predators are currently searching for a new general manager while they consider trading Ryan O'Reilly, Michael Bunting, Michael McCarron, and Nick Perbix before the March 6 trade deadline.

title: Kevin O’Leary to young founders: Stop glorifying working 18 hours a day
description: Kevin O'Leary, once a proponent of extreme hustle culture, has reversed his stance, now calling the idea of working 18-hour days "stupid." He emphasizes that good food, sleep, and exercise are crucial for making sound business decisions, particularly major ones made in the morning. O'Leary now avoids investing in founders who appear exhausted, believing rest is essential for success.
